alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 26 at 8:53PM MST until January 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PROLONGED PERIOD OF HEAVIER SNOW AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS LATE FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .Light snow will decrease towards dawn with a lull in the snowfall expected Friday morning. Snow will increase in coverage and intensity later Friday afternoon and night with arrival of next shot of energy and deeper moisture. The heaviest snow will impact the Park Range, including Rabbit Ears Pass, and to a slightly lesser extent the northern Front Range mountains (Medicine Bow Range, Rocky Mountain NP). Additionally, strong winds will be present at times through Friday, resulting in blowing snow, poor visibility and treacherous conditions for most mountains passes/roadways. Lighter snow will impact the I-70 mountain corridor beginning Friday, and will likely lead to deteriorated conditions coinciding with weekend ski traffic. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Light snow decreasing later tonight and early Friday morning with only 1 to 3 inches through Friday morning. Snow becoming heavier again Friday afternoon and night. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 24 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph over the higher peaks. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible from late Friday through Saturday. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
